content.question: The graph shows the foreign exchange market for the British poundÂ <math alttext="open parenthesis, G B P, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>GBP</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the exchange rate is $1.70, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The British pound is in equilibrium.
The surplus of British pounds will cause the British pound to depreciate.
The shortage of British pounds will cause the British pound to depreciate.
The surplus of British pounds will cause the British pound to appreciate.
The shortage of British pounds will cause the British pound to appreciate.

content.answer: The surplus of British pounds will cause the British pound to depreciate.

unit.text: 6: Open Economy - International Trade and Finance

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
